claim: Adelanto is the only city with a K–8 magnet school offering Multiple Provision Types, and it has exactly one such school.
extra_info: Kindergarten to 8th grade refers to K-8; 'Offers a magnet program' means Magnet = 1; Multiple Provision Types refers to `NSLP Provision Status` = 'Multiple Provision Types'
reasoning: The query for K-8 magnet schools (GSoffered='K-8', Magnet=1) with NSLP Provision Status='Multiple Provision Types' returns exactly one result: 'George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle' in Adelanto. This confirms Adelanto is the only city with such a school and it has exactly one.

    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,

);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);

content.text: Now let me query for K-8 magnet schools with "Multiple Provision Types":

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT s.City, s.School, s.GSoffered, s.Magnet, f.\"NSLP Provision Status\" FROM schools s JOIN frpm f ON s.CDSCode = f.CDSCode WHERE s.GSoffered = 'K-8' AND s.Magnet = 1 AND f.\"NSLP Provision Status\" = 'Multiple Provision Types';"
input.description: Find K-8 magnet schools with Multiple Provision Types

content.content: Adelanto|George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle|K-8|1|Multiple Provision Types

tool_use_result.stdout: Adelanto|George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle|K-8|1|Multiple Provision Types

content.text:
The query returns exactly one result: a school in Adelanto called "George Visual and Performing Arts Magnet and Middle" which is K-8, is a magnet school (Magnet=1), and has `NSLP Provision Status` = 'Multiple Provision Types'.

This confirms:
1. Adelanto is the **only** city with such a school.
2. There is **exactly one** such school.
